thread.title: Few schools show growth and improvement in Advanced Placement classes
thread.title_full: Few schools show growth and improvement in Advanced Placement classes

author: Eric Stirgus
title: Few schools show growth and improvement in Advanced Placement classes

locations.name: atlanta bryan county buford butts county cherokee county forsyth county harris county houston county walton county

organizations.name: college board the nation’s advanced placement school distri

text:
Gwinnett County was named Tuesday by the College Board the nation’s Advanced Placement school district of the year among larger school districts.
The school district was recognized for its efforts to get more students to take the rigorous courses and for getting students, particularly low-income students, to pass at least once AP exam.
Only three percent of public school districts nationwide saw increases in AP participation and student performance. Ten of them are in Georgia. The others were:
Atlanta Bryan County Buford Butts County Cherokee County Forsyth County Harris County Houston County Walton County
